question.title: Java springboot application does not "see" dependency unless that dependency's plugin is compiled with specific info
question.body:
I have a Java Springboot application which I have added as a dependency. Lets call this application A. This dependant project is a API making use of controller classes (@RestController annotation). In my pom file inside the dependent application (let call it Application B) if I build this Maven project like below (pom.1), then I cannot "see" the dependency pacakage that I added. It tells me "Cannot resolve symbol '[package name]'". However if I use the plugin config from pom.2 below, then the dependency resolves and builds fine. Why is this?

I need to reference some classes in the dependency from Application B,hence the reason adding it to Application A.

I then try to debug this application (A), but then I get the following error when the project starts up (My IPPUCommonMessageRepository class does have the @Repository annotation):

pom.1 extract


<plugin>
    <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
    <configuration>
        <executable>true</executable>
    </configuration>
</plugin>`

pom.2 extract

<plugin>
    <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
    <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
     <executions>
         <execution>
              <goals>
                  <goal>repackage</goal>
              </goals>
         </execution>
     </executions>
     <configuration>
         <classifier>executable</classifier>
         <executable>true</executable>
     </configuration>
</plugin>

I tried to build with various ComponentScan and EntityScan annotations, different POM file configs, nothing seem to work.

Annotations used from application A:

@SpringBootApplication
@EnableQ2
@EntityScan("za.co.companyname.microservice.merchant_terminal_management*")
@EnableJpaRepositories("za.co.companyname.microservice.merchant_terminal_management*")
@ComponentScan("za.co.companyname.prepaid_utilities_switch*")

question_comments.body: Reading this question, I was sure it was going to be a problem with missing ComponentScan annotations, until I got to the last line. Can you edit to show which annotations you tried?
